citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility's current program of veterinary care does not include birds, of which over 500 individuals are kept at the
facility. A program of adequate veterinary care must be established by the facility and approved by the attending
veterinarian to ensure: the appropriateness of the facilities for the species kept, that appropriate methods are employed
for the prevention, control, diagnoses and treatment of disease, and that adequate guidance is provided to personnel
involved in the care and use of animals, among other things outlined in this section of the Act. The absence of a program
of adequate veterinary care and formal veterinary care for birds could lead to poor health and welfare outcomes for this
group of animals.
Correct by ensuring that the program of veterinary care includes all regulated animals at the facility, and that the attending
veterinarian is given adequate authority for their care by formal arrangement. Correct by September 22, 2023.

The facility has not developed a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster.
A written plan shall be developed and maintained to provide guidance for the appropriate care of the animals during
emergencies that could reasonably be anticipated. The plan shall address specific tasks required to be carried out in
response to the identified emergencies, personnel responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of command, etc., as
required in Section 2.134 of the animal welfare regulations.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement, that addresses the required
elements approved by the attending veterinarian, is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by September 30,
2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee, Petting Farm Manager and Office Manger.
